intro: Oenanthe fistulifolia, commonly known as the common cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, arranged in umbels, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Oenanthe fistulifolia is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, and it has been used historically in traditional medicine.
